snippet: Donna Taylor, the principal of the Brooklyn School of Inquiry, said she regretted telling a group of parents and children that “if you don’t speak Spanish, you’re going to clean your own house.”
abstract: Principal Donna Taylor of Brooklyn's elite Public School Intermediate School 686, also known as Brooklyn School of Inquiry, apologizes for remark about learning Spanish that infuriated several parents; Taylor had told group of children and parents that 'if you don't speak Spanish, you're going to clean your own house.'
lead_paragraph: Donna Taylor, the principal of the Brooklyn School of Inquiry, said she regretted telling a group of parents and children that “if you don’t speak Spanish, you’re going to clean your own house.”

headline.main: Brooklyn Principal Apologizes for Remark Deemed Offensive
headline.print_headline: After Offending With Comment, Brooklyn Principal Apologizes
